result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J. Humes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Schleiss.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from Nadia G.  Court imposes a total sentence of 4 years WSP concurrent to 11CF272; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 145 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

On State's motion, cts 1, 2, 4, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 2/6/15 at 9am. Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Schleis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Ludwig hearing held.  Nidia G.V. present.  ADA Graveley withdraws the State's offer.  JS set for 1/26/15 at 9am; JSH set for 12/8/14 at 9am.  Atty Schleis motion to modify bond.  ADA Graveley opposes motion.  Court denies motion to modify bond, enters no contact order while in custody, no contact by phone or by any other means.  ADA Graveley to prepare order.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Adam Schleis, who has not been retained but appears as a friend of the court.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has discussed State's plea offer with Atty Schleis and rejects the offer.  State's plea offer is withdrawn.  KPD Officers Willie Hamilton and Douglas Ball testified on behalf of the State.  Probable cause found; bound over to Br. 6.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  Speedy trial demanded.  FPT 10/17/14 at 8:45.  STC 11/7/14 at 11:00.  Bond continued.
